heading: 2. The Oireachtas (Allowances) (Members and Holders of Parliamentary
text_raw:
2. The Oireachtas (Allowances) (Members and Holders of Parliamentary 
and Certain Ministerial Offices) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 613 of 2020) is amended 
– 

(a) 

by the substitution of the following Article for Article 5: 

“5. There is payable to – 

(a) Hildegarde Naughton, Minister of State at – 

(i) 

the Department of the Taoiseach, and 

(ii) 

the Department of Education, 

as the holder of those offices who regularly attends 
meetings of the Government, an annual allowance – 

(I) 

at the rate of €12,886 for any period 
beginning on or after 9 April 2024, 

(II) at the rate of €13,015 for any period 

beginning on or after 1 June 2024, and 

(III) at the rate of €13,145 for any period 

beginning on or after 01 October 2024, 

(b) Dara Calleary, Minister of State at the Department of 
Enterprise, Trade and Employment, as the holder of 
that office who regularly attends meetings of the 
Government, an annual allowance – 

(i) 

at the rate of €13,015 for any period beginning 
on or after 27 June 2024, and 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 18th October, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [541] 3 

at the rate of €13,145 for any period beginning 
on or after 01 October 2024, 

(ii) 

and 

(c) Pippa Hackett, Minister of State at the Department of 
Agriculture, Food and the Marine, as the holder of 
that office who regularly attends meetings of the 
Government, an annual allowance – 

(i) 

(ii) 

at the rate of €12,173 for any period beginning 
on or after 17 December 2022, 

at the rate of €12,416 for any period beginning 
on or after 01 March 2023, 

(iii) at the rate of €12,602 for any period beginning 

on or after 01 October 2023, 

(iv) at the rate of €12,886 for any period beginning 

on or after 01 January 2024, 

(v) 

at the rate of €13,015 for any period beginning 
on or after 01 June 2024, and 

(vi) at the rate of €13,145 for any period beginning 

on or after 01 October 2024.”, 

and 

(b) 

in Article 6, by the insertion of the following paragraph after 
paragraph (8): 

“(9) There is payable to a member of the Oireachtas who holds 
or held the position of chairperson of the Oireachtas 
Committee known as the Joint Committee on Drugs Use an 
allowance, in respect of the member’s duties as holder of 
that position, annually – 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

at the rate of €10,673 in respect of any period 
beginning on or after 14 May 2024, 

at the rate of €10,780 in respect of any period 
beginning on or after 1 June 2024, and 

at the rate of €10,888 in respect of any period 
beginning on or after 1 October 2024, 

during which the member held that position.”.

SIMON HARRIS,
